title: Urban Insight: SysAdmin with Drupal Experience - Part Time
description:
Headquarters: Remote
    
URL: http://urbaninsight.com



Who We Are
Urban Insight is a leading digital agency creating innovative websites and web applications for organizations that make a difference. We specialize in solving complex problems through website and web app strategy, design and development using open-source content management systems (primarily, Drupal and WordPress, and headless or composable architectures). Our clients include some of the most well-known museums, nonprofits, universities, cities, and other institutions. Urban Insight has been in business for 25 years and continues to expand each year. We thrive on having a professionally rewarding environment where team members are encouraged to grow.
¬†
The Opportunity
We are seeking a skilled, detail-oriented SysAdmin. The right individual will have a passion for efficiency, problem-solving, and collaboration. In this role at Urban Insight, you will manage all aspects of our systems, software, and developer operations. You will be instrumental in ensuring the stability, security, and optimal performance of our website development systems, tools, and processes. The ideal candidate will have experience as an IT generalist, and be able to provide guidance and technical support across the company. This position reports to the Director of Infrastructure and will collaborate closely with the Development Department and the entire Urban Insight team.
¬†
Key Responsibilities

Manage hardware, software, and account access; and provide technical support and troubleshooting across our fully remote, distributed team.

Be the face of technology for all new hires for onboarding and handle all offboarding activities.¬†

Manage the security and reliability of our websites (primarily, Drupal and Wordpress), systems, and internal infrastructure.

Collaborate with developers to ensure consistent and efficient work. Make sure they follow best practices, use the right tools, and maintain a strong working relationship.

Develop and maintain technical documentation, technical policies & procedures; and foster a culture of strong documentation.

Manage and perform hosting setup and configuration, security upgrades, and site launches for client projects.
¬†

Qualifications

5+ years proven experience as a Systems Administrator or similar role.

Hands-on experience with open-source CMS frameworks such as Drupal & WordPress.

Strong knowledge of system and network administration, including proficiency in Linux/Unix and MacOS environments.

Experience with cloud platform setup and maintenance (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).

Familiarity with web development technologies and tools (e.g. Lando, Docker, Composer).

Solid understanding of security best practices and the ability to implement and monitor them effectively.

Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Ability to work well in a collaborative team environment.

Relevant certifications (e.g. AWS Certified SysOps, LPIC-1, CISSP) are a plus.
¬†

About Urban Insight

Urban Insight is a leading digital agency with 35+ team members. https://www.urbaninsight.com/ ¬†¬†

We work with some of the best-known museums, nonprofits and other institutions, such as LACMA, The Broad, University of Southern California, City of Los Angeles, and the Japanese American National Museum.

We‚Äôve won numerous design awards including such as for our work for Stay Housed Los Angeles and the National World War 1 Museum & Memorial.

We‚Äôre the top-ranked Web development agency in Los Angeles, according to Clutch, an independent analyst. Have a look at what our clients say about us: https://clutch.co/profile/urban-insight¬†

We have a clearly defined project management methodology and case management system.

We run on the Entrepreneurial Operating System.
¬†

Why Work at Urban Insight?

We take on interesting, meaningful projects for appreciative clients.

We offer a flexible working environment - work from anywhere in the United States.

We work with you to create a career path that works for you.

The average employee tenure is 6.5 years.

We're stable and growing. We've been in business for 23+ years and continue to grow each year.

We offer a casual and flexible working environment with plenty of opportunities for growth for the right candidate.

We believe in a reasonable life/work balance and enjoy 40-hour work weeks.

We allocate resources and time for training and professional development.

We have weekly events to keep the team connected: Lunch & Learns, Lightning Demos, Game Breaks.

There are many more reasons: https://www.urbaninsight.com/careers¬†


Compensation
We offer a highly competitive salary, which depends on your qualifications and experience. Our salary package includes:

Rate: $30-45/hr depending upon experience.

Approx Schedule: 18 hours per week

Performance and compensation reviews annually.

 

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/urban-insight-sysadmin-with-drupal-experience-part-time

title: Shippo: Engineering Manager, Web App (Remote)
description:
Headquarters: United States
    
URL: http://goshippo.com




Here at Shippo, we are the shipping layer of the internet and we consider ourselves to be one of the core building blocks of e-commerce. Our mission is to make merchants successful through world class shipping. With our products and solutions, we level the playing field by providing our customers with best-in-class solutions that otherwise wouldn‚Äôt be available to them. Through Shippo e-commerce businesses, marketplaces, platforms and a variety of logistics infrastructure providers are able to connect to shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard. We provide our customers with the most competitive shipping rates, print labels, automated international documents, shipment tracking, facilitate the returns process and more.


How we‚Äôll deliver success:


As an Engineering Manager for one of Shippo‚Äôs web application teams, you‚Äôll lead a cross-functional group of backend, frontend, and fullstack engineers. Your team owns our Order Management system ‚Äî the foundation that powers merchants‚Äô ability to manage, fulfill, and track their orders ‚Äî and contributes to product-led UX initiatives that improve the end-to-end shipping experience.


You‚Äôll play a critical role in defining technical direction, driving execution, and growing engineers while partnering closely with Product, Design, and other engineering teams.


Shipping & handling responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and grow a diverse team of backend, frontend, and fullstack engineers
Set direction for the Order Management domain ‚Äî ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability
Own UX and Webapp core experience improvements that increase merchant success and operational efficiency
Partner cross-functionally with Product and Design to define roadmaps, deliver high-impact features, and iterate quickly
Foster a culture of ownership, accountability, and continuous improvement through compassionate candor and clear feedback
Champion engineering excellence: reliability, performance, observability, and automation across services and web applications
Own SLAs/SLOs for key Order Management APIs and workflows, driving adoption of best practices across dependent systems
Lead incident response and root cause analysis with a focus on learning and prevention
Contribute to the technical roadmap, balancing product innovation with system health and technical debt reduction



Requirements

3+ years of experience managing software engineering teams, including hiring, performance, and career development
9+ years of overall software engineering experience with a track record of delivering complex, scalable systems
Strong backend technical foundation (Python, Go, Java, or Ruby) and familiarity with modern frameworks (e.g., Django, FastAPI)
Proven experience designing, integrating, and maintaining APIs (REST, gRPC, SOAP)
Strong communication skills, with the ability to influence across teams and disciplines
Deep customer empathy and a focus on delivering measurable value to merchants
Experience leading teams through both technical execution and organizational change



Bonus

Familiarity with React.js and modern JavaScript frameworks
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., DynamoDB)
Exposure to event-driven architectures and queue systems (e.g., Redis, Kafka, NSQ)
Experience managing external vendor integrations and partner APIs



$175,000 - $238,000 a year

Our Compensation Shippolicy:
We believe compensation is a custom experience and are commited to fair and equitable compensation practices. The standard base pay range for this role is min is $175k to a max $238k annual salary. Since we are focused on hiring Shippos Everywhere, we have 2 US pay ranges, a standard compensation range for the majority of the US and a standard +1 compensation range for those who live in areas where the cost of labor is higher, such as NYC and California.
The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: financial budgets, work experience, training, transferable skills, business needs, and market value. The base pay salary ranges are subject to change and may be modified in the future. Total compensation for this role will include, equity, medical, dental, vision and other benefits noted in our Shippos ‚Äúpackage‚Äù section.


Sail through the process:
Here at Shippo, we celebrate inclusivity and are committed to creating equal access to opportunities for people from all backgrounds, perspectives and geographies. These values define who we are and everything we do. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. If you need assistance, or a reasonable accommodation during the application and recruiting process, please contact us at accommodations@goshippo.com


Shippos in the wild:
Our people, much like the packages we help ship, are all over the world. This means, through our remote-first program, ‚ÄúShippos Everywhere‚Äù, our roles can be based anywhere in the US with the exception of Delaware, Nevada, Ohio, Oregon, Hawaii, New Mexico and West Virginia and many roles can be based internationally.
For locations outside of the US and Ireland, the employment contracts are powered by Remote.com (all Shippo perks still apply - including equity!). What we want to emphasize is that you can be successful at Shippo regardless of location.


We leverage AI to review all resumes during the application phase to ensure fairness, comprehensively evaluate each submission, and mitigate bias. However, all decisions at every stage of the process are made by a real person.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.



To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/shippo-engineering-manager-web-app-remote

title: FS Studio: Wordpress Web Developer
description:
Headquarters: Argentina
    
URL: http://fsstudio.com


Web Developer (WordPress / Design Implementation)
Location: Remote
Type: Contract
FS Studio is looking for a talented Web Developer to join our team to bring our new website vision to life. We‚Äôve designed our site in Framer and now need someone with both strong WordPress development skills and a sharp design eye to translate it into a polished, production-ready site.
Responsibilities

Translate the completed Framer design into a fully functional WordPress site, ensuring fidelity to the original layout, typography, and interactions.

Apply refinements and polish to the site‚Äîspacing, alignment, responsiveness, and micro-interactions‚Äîto elevate the overall design quality.

Implement mobile-first responsive design across devices and browsers.

Optimize the site for performance, accessibility, and SEO best practices.

Integrate required plugins, forms, and CMS features while maintaining a clean, maintainable codebase.

Collaborate with the FS Studio team to finalize details and provide input on UI/UX improvements.

Qualifications

Proven experience building and customizing WordPress websites from provided designs (portfolio required).

Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and PHP.

Experience with WordPress theme customization and plugin integration.

Keen design sensibility: ability to match and enhance design details, not just replicate them.

Solid understanding of responsive design, accessibility standards, and cross-browser compatibility.

Familiarity with SEO optimization and website performance best practices.

Bonus: experience working with Framer designs or similar design-to-development workflows.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
This role is perfect for someone who thrives at the intersection of development and design‚Äîyou‚Äôre not just a coder, but someone who cares about the craft of making a site look and feel exceptional.
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/fs-studio-wordpress-web-developer

title: Jobgether: Web Developer (Remote)
description:
Headquarters: United States
    
URL: http://jobgether.com


Description
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Web Developer (Remote) in the United States.
As a Web Developer, you will have the opportunity to design, build, and maintain interactive, high-quality web applications that support a variety of projects and initiatives. Working remotely, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement responsive designs, integrate back-end data sources, and deliver user-friendly digital solutions. This role emphasizes creative problem-solving, iterative development, and staying current with the latest web technologies and best practices. You will contribute to impactful projects while growing your technical skills in a supportive and flexible environment.
 
Accountabilities

Collaborate with project teams to plan, design, and develop web applications that meet functional and technical requirements.
Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to visualize application features and user interfaces.
Build cross-browser compatible front-end applications using HTML5, CSS3, TypeScript, and related frameworks.
Access and integrate data from various back-end services and databases.
Participate in quality initiatives to maintain high standards of software performance and reliability.
Research, recommend, and implement new tools, technologies, and development methodologies.

 
Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 1 year of experience developing and maintaining interactive web applications.
Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, TypeScript/JavaScript, and web development frameworks (e.g., npm, jQuery, Bootstrap).
Experience with responsive design, UI/UX prototyping, and wireframing tools.
Familiarity with object-oriented programming languages such as C# or Java.
Strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and a willingness to learn new technologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in remote and team-based settings.
Preferred: experience with SCSS/SASS and knowledge of RESTful web services.
Legal authorization to work in the United States without future sponsorship requirements.

 
Benefits

Competitive salary range ($88,000 - $99,000) with merit-based increases and bonus opportunities.
Flexible remote work environment to support work-life balance.
Comprehensive insurance options including health, dental, life, and short- and long-term disability.
Paid time off and parental leave programs.
Retirement savings options such as a 401(k) plan.
Professional development opportunities including education reimbursement and training programs.
Inclusive and collaborative company culture focused on innovation and personal growth.

 
 Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.
When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.
 üîç Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.
 üìä It compares your profile to the job‚Äôs core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.
 üéØ Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the three candidates with the highest match to the role.
 üß† When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.
This process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias, focusing solely on your fit for the role.
 Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company offering the position. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or assessments) are made by their internal hiring team.
Thank you for your interest!
¬†

#LI-CL1
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/jobgether-web-developer-remote

title: Syteca: Web Developer
description:
Headquarters: Lviv, UA
    
URL: http://syteca.com



Syteca Inc. is a recognized software vendor delivering a cybersecurity platform dedicated to inside perimeter security. The Syteca platform provides advanced user activity monitoring (UAM) and robust privileged access management (PAM) solutions to organizations in every industry and sector.
Founded as Ekran System in 2013 by a team of passionate cybersecurity experts, Syteca Inc. has grown into a global cybersecurity provider for more than 1,500 organizations across every industry on every continent. With headquarters in Needham, MA, USA, and a worldwide network of offices and partners, we're dedicated to safeguarding organizations of all sizes from human-related risks.
We invite a Web Developer who is excited about technology to join our team. 
You will learn from our experts and get a unique experience to become an expert yourself.  
Responsibilities: 
- Implementing new features
- Bugs fixing and support of the existing system

- CI/CD activities, production maintenance 
Requirements: 
- 3 years of commercial experience with specified tech tasks
- Work experience with WordPress (Gutenberg), PHP, MySQL 
- Proficiency in JavaScript, CSS, HTML 

- Knowledge of Linux, Docker, Nginx 
- Ready to learn React.js & .NET and handle some minor task in this tech stack
- English level: pre-intermediate
Would be a plus: 
-Knowledge of Bootstrap, SCSS, Bamboo, Cloudflare 
Our benefits:
-Remote/hybrid work according to your needs
-Flexible working hours
-20 working days of paid annual leave and paid sick leaves
-Necessary equipment - a laptop, monitor, additional accessories
-Career advancement and professional growth
-Personalized learning approach (mentoring, internal courses, knowledge sharing)
-Regular development - experienced team, regular 1: 1, development plan according to your needs
-English lessons and practice with a native speaker
If you are interested in this position, please send us your detailed CV.


To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/syteca-web-developer

title: Rocky Mountain College of Art + Design: Subject Matter Expert | Web Design I
description:
Headquarters: Remote
    
URL: http://rmcad.edu




Subject Matter Expert | Web Design I
Graphic Design 3115¬†a studio level course within our Graphic Design department. This intermediate course focuses on taking the principles from traditional graphic design and applying them to the online environment. Students are introduced to site architecture, concept mapping, and digital code. Websites will be tested and used for optimal browser display, information architecture, and user needs. Upon successful completion of this course, students will have gained an understanding of the common challenges of creating and design in interactive media through prototyping, flow-charting, pre-production, production, and execution of a final website design. RMCAD aims for the Subject Matter Expert (SME) to construct the course, ensuring it‚Äôs prepared for launch.

¬†
Collaborate with instructional designers and fellow faculty members to develop an engaging and innovating course¬†
Mentor and support students in their creative and technical endeavors, fostering an applied and experiential learning environment
Contribute to the ongoing development and expansion of our progressive Graphic Design program

Qualifications:
Master's degree or higher
Must¬†live in one of the following states: AZ, CA, CO, FL, NY, VA or TX
Experience in course design and development processes, preferably for asynchronous online delivery
Proven track record of successful experiential and applied approaches to student learning
Experience or knowledge of asynchronous online education, and proficiency in using learning management systems and online teaching tools


Review of applications will begin as soon as possible and continue until the position is filled. Ideally, RMCAD aims for the Subject Matter Expert (SME) to construct the course, ensuring it‚Äôs prepared for launch by the fall A semester.
Rocky Mountain College of Art + Design is an Equal Opportunity Employer



To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/rocky-mountain-college-of-art-design-subject-matter-expert-web-design-i

title: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints: Frontend Web Development Grader - BYU-Pathway Worldwide
description:
Headquarters: Sao Paulo, SP, Brazil
    
URL: http://churchofjesuschrist.org


Description
Candidates must be fluent in English and submit their application in English to be considered.
Only those currently living in and authorized to work in Brazil are eligible.
The application system will store candidate information. Once submitted, application details will be shared with Church Education System (CES) partners involved in the selection process. Applicants may receive a rejection email during or after review; however, unless a direct rejection is received from the hiring manager, applications will remain active and under consideration.
This posting serves as an interest list for future opportunities. Because hiring is based on enrollment needs, applicants may not be contacted immediately. Candidates not selected at this time will remain on file for consideration as future positions become available.
If you have any questions, please contact our Human Resources representative, Easton at ebiddulph@byupw.edu.
¬†
Job Description
BYU Pathway and BYU Idaho online courses include both an instructor and graders. Instructors handle teaching and overall course delivery, while graders support learning by evaluating assignments and providing constructive feedback. We are seeking graders (support staff) who will apply their skills and subject expertise to grade assignments, support student learning, provide feedback, and collaborate with instructors.
Important: This is a part-time work-from-home position with the following flexible schedule:

10-12 hours per week (may vary week-to-week)

Course Description
Grading support (using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS) for:

WDD 130 - Web Fundamentals
WDD 131 ‚Äì Dynamic Web Fundamentals
WDD 231 - Web Frontend Development I
WDD 330 - Web Frontend Development II

These courses provide students with foundational web design and development skills, enabling them to contribute to web development teams.

Responsibilities

Using university and department procedures and materials to evaluate student work (rubrics and feedback templates).
Ensuring feedback is actionable, timely, and accurate.
Responding to student questions and concerns about scoring.
Coordinating with supervisors for quick resolution of grading issues.
Participating in training sessions to receive guidance and feedback.
Applying feedback from training and quality checks to improve performance.
Performing other duties as assigned in support of the academic process.

Qualifications
NOTE: An applicant‚Äôs r√©sum√© and official transcripts will be used to determine eligibility for grading the Frontend Web Development courses. Please clearly highlight relevant education, professional work, and technologies on your r√©sum√©.
¬†
General Grader Requirements:

Degree or coursework in a related field.
Demonstrated subject matter expertise.
Fluency in Portuguese and English (required).
Experience with online teaching/learning, especially with at-risk learners (preferred).
High accuracy, efficiency, and reliability in following procedures and meeting deadlines.
Ability to focus and maintain quality, even with repetitive or complex tasks.
Adaptability to new processes, procedures, and technologies.
Professional, respectful, and unbiased in sensitive situations.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and discipline-specific software.
Proven ability to grade effectively within these subject areas.

¬†
Specific Course Requirements: Frontend Web Development

A bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or a related field is preferred.
Equivalent education and/or work experience may be considered.
Experience with the following is required: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JSON.
Understanding of web design principles, such as simplicity, responsiveness, usability, and visual design.
Expert proficiency with basic web design and development concepts, such as DOM manipulation, form and event handling, JavaScript objects and functions, CSS layout and presentation, and data retrieval mechanisms.
Experience with version control software, such as GitHub.
Experience with code editors, such as Visual Studio Code.
Experience with browser tools, such as Chrome Developer Tools.
Attention to detail.
Ability to follow test cases with efficiency, exactness, and accuracy.
Ability to quickly read and debug imperfect code.
Ability to communicate clearly in writing.

¬†
Additional Documentation Requirement
Candidates who are selected to advance to the next stages of the hiring process will be required to provide the following academic documents:

Copy of original transcript (hist√≥rico escolar)
Copy of diploma (front and back) that clearly shows either the date of completion or the date of graduation/commencement ceremony (data da cola√ß√£o de grau)

Academic documents issued by Brazilian or international institutions are acceptable, provided that the documents are officially recognized in Brazil and their country of origin. (Bacharelado/Licenciatura)
¬†
Documenta√ß√£o Adicional Requerida
Os(as) candidatos(as) selecionados(as) para as pr√≥ximas etapas do processo seletivo dever√£o apresentar os seguintes documentos acad√™micos:

C√≥pia do hist√≥rico escolar (original).
C√≥pia do diploma (frente e verso) que comprove claramente a data de conclus√£o ou a data da cola√ß√£o de grau.

Ser√£o aceitos documentos acad√™micos emitidos por institui√ß√µes brasileiras ou estrangeiras, desde que reconhecidos oficialmente no Brasil e no pa√≠s de origem (Bacharelado/Licenciatura).

title: WeAssist.io: Shopify Web Developer (IB)
description:
Headquarters: Philippines
    
URL: http://weassist.io



Hiring: Full-time Shopify Web Developer - Remote - $18,000 - $24,000/yr

üöÄ About the Client üöÄ
üß∫ Luxury Laundry Care ‚Äì Premium detergents and products that transform everyday laundry into a refined experience
üå∏ Signature Fragrances ‚Äì Unique scent profiles crafted to stand apart in the market
üìà Fast-Growing ‚Äì Millions in annual revenue, scaling quickly with high-impact launches
ü§ù Collaborative Spirit ‚Äì Cross-functional teamwork with marketing, design, and growth teams
üåç Entrepreneurial Culture ‚Äì Creative, fast-paced, and results-oriented

üåü About WeAssist üí°
üåç Led by a Founder Who Cares ‚Äì Reef Colman built WeAssist to empower individuals and create meaningful opportunities that support families.
‚ö° Fast & Purposeful Recruiting ‚Äì We move quickly but prioritize long-term fit, stability, and growth over just filling roles.
üåé Connecting Global Talent ‚Äì With 100+ outsourced professionals and growing, we link top talent worldwide with thriving US businesses.
‚ù§Ô∏è Giving Back Matters ‚Äì From building schools to feeding the homeless, we believe true success means making a difference.
ü§ù An Inclusive & Thriving Culture ‚Äì Your skills and unique gifts matter. We create an environment where outsourced professionals don‚Äôt just work‚Äîthey grow.

‚öíÔ∏è Key Responsibilities of the Shopify Web Developer üìù
üõç Store Dev & Customization
‚ö° Site Optimization & Performance
üõ† Troubleshooting & Maintenance
üîó Integrations & Automation
ü§ù Collaboration & Growth
üìà Research & Innovation


Additional Information: 
Review this Doc first!
How to Prepare for the Recruiting Process - 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tCWNqlU4gNG4nQaEeo5iSKNB8A8X7xAlVCMDvZwkdDk/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.gt6n5ybw2ujb 


üì¢ Why Are They Hiring a Shopify Web Developer?
Our client is hiring a Shopify Web Developer to own their e-commerce storefront end-to-end. With frequent product launches and a rapidly scaling customer base, they need someone who can keep the site fast, functional, and flawless. This isn‚Äôt just about writing code‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating a high-converting, beautifully designed shopping experience that delights customers and drives growth.
If you‚Äôre excited to bring design, performance, and innovation together to power a fast-growing luxury brand, this is your chance to make a visible impact every single day. üöÄ 
‚úÖQualifications:
Must-Have: 
üíª 3+ years of Shopify development experience (Shopify Plus preferred)
üåê Strong in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Liquid, and responsive design principles
üé® Understanding of e-commerce UX/UI best practices
üîó Experience with APIs, third-party app integrations, and Shopify Scripts
üìä Familiarity with SEO best practices for Shopify
‚ö° Comfortable in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
üó£ Strong communication and cross-team collaboration skills

Nice to Have:
Experience with subscriptions (Recharge, Skio, etc.)
Familiarity with analytics (Google Analytics, TripleWhale)
Background in DTC premium/lifestyle brands





Responsibilities of the Shopify Web Developer:
Your responsibilities include:
üõç Store Development & Customization
Develop, customize, and maintain the Shopify Plus storefront and related integrations
Implement pixel-perfect designs from Figma into responsive Shopify themes
Develop both front-end and back-end features 
Launch new products and campaigns every 4‚Äì6 weeks, ensuring flawless rollouts
Ensure creative assets from design/marketing are implemented seamlessly
Integrate and customize Shopify apps, scripts, and APIs as needed



‚ö° Site Optimization & Performance
Continuously monitor and improve site speed, load times, and responsiveness
Optimize scripts, images, and code to support a mobile-first experience
Leverage PageSpeed Insights and other tools to maintain high performance scores
Proactively identify bottlenecks and implement long-term performance fixes



üõ† Troubleshooting & Maintenance
Quickly debug and resolve technical issues to minimize downtime
Test changes in staging environments before deployment
Deploy updates during low-traffic windows to protect customer experience
Maintain clean code and ensure consistency across updates



üîó Integrations & Automation
Manage critical integrations (Recharge, Klaviyo, TripleWhale, analytics, and pixel tracking)
Troubleshoot app conflicts and ensure all third-party tools work seamlessly
Recommend new apps, tools, and automations to streamline workflows



ü§ù Collaboration & Growth
Partner with marketing/design teams to execute high-impact launches
Provide feasibility input on timelines and campaigns
Share ideas to improve UX, conversions, and checkout flow
Stay current with Shopify updates and e-commerce best practices
Document processes and create scalable dev workflows for future growth



üìà Research & Innovation
Explore emerging Shopify trends and suggest opportunities for innovation
Test and recommend A/B strategies to improve conversion rates
Contribute insights to strengthen the DTC customer journey




üè° Want to Know More About the Client?
Our client is transforming the way people experience everyday laundry by turning it into a luxury ritual. As a premium direct-to-consumer laundry care brand, they blend sophisticated fragrances, high-performance cleaning formulas, and elevated design to bring elegance to the most ordinary of routines. Their products stand out in a crowded market by offering customers not just clean clothes, but an indulgent, memorable experience. With sustainability at the core, they‚Äôve replaced bulky plastic jugs with eco-friendly boxes made from 60% post-consumer recycled cardboard. Backed by millions in annual revenue and a loyal, growing community, they‚Äôre scaling rapidly while staying true to their values of creativity, performance, and innovation. 
Joining their team means shaping a brand that elevates everyday life with beauty, purpose, and impact. üåü

What‚Äôs in it for you? üòè
Joining this client means not just filling a role but embarking on a personal development journey. The growth potential is substantial, with opportunities to:
üí∞ Competitive Pay ‚Äì Rewarding package aligned with experience, skill, and the impact you bring
üåé Remote-First ‚Äì Work from anywhere with slightly flexible hours
üìà Growth Path ‚Äì Opportunity to step into strategic ownership of site development and even lead future dev hires
